sub_title: Planning, Monitoring & Evaluation, and Learning Coordinator | MSc in Global Health
summary:
I am a global health professional with experience in and a passion for monitoring & evaluation and programme management; I am very much intrigued by international health matters and energised by working on locally owned and community-based interventions. Recently I gained valuable experience in M&E and management advocacy & lobby for SRHR and in tuberculosis. These, along with previous experiences, have strengthened my interest in and fascination for health promotion, civil society strengthening, (international) health policy and the relationship between chronic and infectious disease.
	I am curious and eager to learn, and I flourish in intercultural and interdisciplinary contexts in which I am exposed to ‘the field’. Working in teams in which diversity and interpersonal learning is the norm really makes me enthusiastic and optimistic. I have lived and worked in Kenya, Mongolia, Denmark, Poland, Sri Lanka, Cambodia, and Ukraine.

position_groups:
[{'company': {'id': 443604, 'name': 'Wemos', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQEPU8cD2eJNOw/company-logo_400_400/0/1667906287693?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=B0KmU1ZeSDH2fksII0s01_VnAqiqzFxBxP88OFAuhnc', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/wemos/', 'employees': {'start': 11, 'end': 50}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Wemos', 'description': '• coordinate all planning and reporting processes, incl. development and revisions of Theories of Change and results frameworks
• provide PMEL support to programme implementation teams, with developing PMEL frameworks, participatory data collection and validation, documenting lessons learnt, creating knowledge products
• organise and chair the programme’s PMEL forum
• oversee all programme data management processes, incl. timely, data and information flows, data storage, and quality assurance
• ensure availability of correct and timely data and information to inform (strategic) programme decisions
• support the development of a consortium learning strategy
• coordinate the mid- and end-term evaluations
• set up and manage Make Way’s management information system
• support the technical working groups on assessment tools, advocacy approaches and tools, and youth engagement

The Make Way programme (2021-2025) is funded by the Dutch MFA, and promotes an ‘intersectional lens’ in looking at and advocating sexual and reproductive health and rights.

Wemos is the budget holder of the Make Way consortium, consisting of Akina Mama wa Afrika, the Circle of Concerned African Women Theologians, Forum for African Women Educationalists, Liliane Foundation, VSO Netherlands, and Wemos, in partnership with the Dutch MFA.', 'title': 'PMEL Coordinator for the Make Way programme (the Intersectionality Consortium)', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}, {'location': 'Amsterdam Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'company': 'Wemos', 'description': '• manage, develop and strengthen the organisation’s PMEL strategy, system and processes
• responsible for data collection together with programme teams (using Outcome Harvesting, among others)
• manage project cycles; ensuring quality and timely reporting of activities and outcomes to donors
• develop and revise Wemos’ Theories of Change
• monitor and identify institutional funding opportunities
• strengthen the organisational fundraising strategy
• In 2020: Successfully co-coordinated the proposal development processes for the Make Way programme, and led and developed the PMEL part of the proposal.', 'title': 'Planning, Monitoring & Evaluation Officer', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 635785, 'name': 'KNCV Tuberculosis Foundation', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQGgjv7BN8_ung/company-logo_400_400/0/1679588895280?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=Du2pxvyaxj7EwobxHfWGqkqPhJVrDwsafhNGs42zwOE', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/kncv-tb-plus/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'The Hague Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'KNCV TB Plus', 'description': '•	M&E focal point for half of the 23 Challenge TB countries
•	Coordination of data collection for the global annual/quarterly report, and for the CTB global End of Project Report other initiatives
•	Development of PMU project information systems to report on key performance indicators
•	Preparation of global Quarterly Monitoring and Annual reports, and data collection tools submitted to USAID/W
•	Data quality assurance
•	Support country projects throughout the work plan development and reporting cycles
•	Review of reports and work plans
•	Monitor project milestones and collect deliverables for assigned projects
•	Develop and facilitate in-country and global training courses on various project management and M&E topics', 'title': 'Performance Monitoring Officer - Challenge TB Project Management Unit', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'The Hague Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'KNCV TB Plus', 'description': "Coordination of the implementation of the Challenge TB project in my portfolio countries, responsibility for monitoring progress and evaluating project outcomes, and ensuring adherence to USAID’s and KNCV’s rules and regulations. Portfolio countries: Afghanistan, Botswana, Cambodia, Tajikistan, Ukraine, and Vietnam. Missions to Cambodia and Ukraine, and provided regional M&E trainings in South Africa, Tanzania and Cambodia for our project countries.

Challenge TB is USAID's flagship global mechanism for implementing its TB strategy as well as contributing to TB/HIB activities under PEPFAR. Challenge TB is a 5-year global programme to decrease TB mortality and morbidity in high burdened countries, through collaborations with other national and international initiatives in providing global leadership and support for national TB control efforts. KNCV is leading the international consortium with eight partner organisations: ATS, FHI 360, IRD, JATA, MSH, PATH, The Union and the WHO.", 'title': 'Programme Officer - Challenge TB  Project Management Unit', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 5350, 'name': 'World Health Organization', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQEhC1u0R5DRQQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1663777944960?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=j5hFxDNxJXWTH17YwPs98UUMHEDU2aNYw37szFDW218', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/world-health-organization/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Copenhagen Area, Capital Region, Denmark', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'company': 'World Health Organization', 'description': 'Working within the Alcohol & Illicit Drugs and Prison Health programme -
